metadata.name: Is this role being posted for the immigration team?

title: BI Engineer
content:
Our Opportunity:
Chewy is looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer III to join our Healthcare Analytics Team. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering scalable data infrastructure, developing self-serve analytics tools, and utilizing data visualizations to unlock insights. You will partner directly with Product leaders, IT software and data engineers, business analysts, and business teams to anticipate the data infrastructure and tooling needs of the organization and proactively build solutions that fuel insights.
As part of a team that is constantly launching new businesses and features, you will be responsible for leveraging technical solutions to transform raw data from multiple sources into actionable insights. The ideal candidate is process-oriented, has proven experience integrating and scaling data applications, and intuitively drives improvements through connecting systems with business processes. This candidate has exemplary data visualization and technical problem-solving skills and a penchant for detail. Further, this individual is highly proficient in partnering across technology and business teams and has proven experience delivering high quality results with minimal direction from leadership. Strong written and verbal communication skills are required as this role will interface directly with cross-functional teams to roll out new tools, communicate data infrastructure changes, and share analytical findings with executive leaders. 
What you'll do:
Design and implement data solutions best-suited to deliver business needs and use cases â€” from data lakes to analytics tools, across a progressively evolving technical stack.
Design experiments, develop measurement frameworks, and partner with Product, Tech, and business leaders to generate results, insights, and actions from product launches and feature changes
Design, develop, optimize, and maintain data architecture and pipelines that adhere to ETL principles and business goals.
Proactively assess the data needs of Healthcare and related functions and partner with technical teams to deliver proof of concepts, QA data sources, and deliver new data tables, metrics, and analytics products
Lead efforts to automate data extraction and distribution of reports to multiple stakeholders
Own and continually improve metrics documentation and data governance
Construct and deliver analytics product roadmaps that deliver insightful and user-friendly dashboards for both internal and external customers
Partner with IT teams to construct downstream impact analysis and own change management communication for Healthcare data sources
Document technical details of your work using industry standard protocols like Jira, Confluence etc.
Proactively monitor existing metrics, propose new metrics, and work across the organization to deliver actionable intelligence
What you'll need:
Proven experience analyzing clickstream data from sources such as Google Analytics, Adobe,  Segment or other platform
Strong understanding and experience leading experiment design, A/B testing, and other frameworks for evaluating effectiveness of feature and product changes
4-year Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business Analytics, Industrial Engineering or a related field
7+ years automating data processes, developing dashboards, and building scalable analytics solutions in an ecommerce, omni-channel, or retail setting
5+ years of experience managing ETL or data transformation processes, technical architecture documents, and delivering net new or enhancing existing data warehouses
5+ years of experience working with data platforms such as: Snowflake, AWS, Vertica, or other RDB
Strong working knowledge of SQL and proven ability to write, debug, and optimize SQL queries
Programming expertise in Java, Python, Scala, or another modern programming language
Proven experience building self-serve BI solutions and automated reports that enable automated alerting and data quality monitoring
Ability to tailor analytics products to meet the needs of end customers using tools ranging from Excel to Tableau
Proven experience with data modeling in large Data warehousing / data lake environments
Strong written and verbal communication skills and experience leading change management processes
Proven experience delivering high quality and insightful data visualizations and translating complex data into actionable insights
Exemplary stakeholder management and prioritization skills using systems, processes, and scalable frameworks
Thorough understanding of Financial KPIs and P&L statement
Superior attention to detail and experience building processes to validate data integrity
Proven experience leading teams and delivering results in ambiguous and resource constrained environments 
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time
Bonus:
Advanced degree such as Masters in Analytics or MBA
Project Management Certification
Experience partnering with Data Science teams to deliver machine learning models from scratch
Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
 
To access Chewy's Customer Privacy Policy, please click here. To access Chewy's California CPRA Job Applicant Privacy Policy, please click here.

questions.label: How did you hear about Chewy?
Have you been employed by Chewy in the past?
What is your expected compensation range for this position?
What is your highest level of education obtained?
Are you legally authorized to work in the United States without employer support or sponsorship?
Will you require sponsorship to work in the United States at any time in the future?
Are you willing to submit to a post-offer, pre-employment background check and drug test?

SMS Consent: By providing my telephone number on this employment application form, I consent to receive automated text messages and pre-recorded voice messages from Chewy at that telephone number regarding any matter related to my job application to Chewy. Chewy will not use this telephone number for marketing or advertising solicitation purposes. Message and data rates may apply. You may opt out of these messages at any time by replying 'STOP' to any text messages you receive.
